content.question:
Students are conducting an experiment on a block that is free to move along a straight, horizontal track with negligible friction. They conduct two trials, Trial <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Trial <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, in which the block is initially at rest and a time-varying horizontal force is applied to the block in a direction parallel to the track. The applied force as a function of time is shown in the graph for each trial, both of which last the same amount of time. During Trial <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, the students do work <math alttext="W sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> on the block and apply an impulse <math alttext="J sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. During Trial <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, they do work <math alttext="W sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> on the block and apply an impulse <math alttext="J sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. How do these values of work and impulse compare to each other?
WorkImpulseA<math alttext="W sub 1 is less than W sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math><math alttext="J sub 1 is less than J sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>B<math alttext="W sub 1 is less than W sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math><math alttext="J sub 1 is greater than J sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>C<math alttext="W sub 1 is greater than W sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math><math alttext="J sub 1 is less than J sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>D<math alttext="W sub 1 is greater than W sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>W</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math><math alttext="J sub 1 is greater than J sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>J</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
